item.title: 10 月份交付量增长强劲，中国电动汽车股票反弹
item.description: 在包括比亚迪公司在内的汽车制造商公布了创纪录的 10 月份交付量之后，中国电动汽车股票大涨，因为政府的补贴政策为这一行业带来了广泛的推动力。【原文：Chinese electric vehicle stocks jumped after automakers including BYD Co. posted record deliveries in October, as government subsidies give a widespread lift to the sector.】

item.title: 印度经济放缓，盈利评级下调如雨下
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 矿业利润下滑，中国顶级煤炭企业向电力领域倾斜
item.description: 随着燃料价格下降和电气化在中国低碳转型中占据中心位置，中国的顶级煤炭生产商正加速向发电领域进军。【原文：China’s top coal producers are accelerating a move into power generation as fuel prices drop and electrification takes center stage in China’s low-carbon transition.】

item.title: 韩国主要反对党支持取消资本利得税的计划
item.description: 韩国主要反对党将支持政府取消对散户投资者的金融投资征收资本利得税计划的决定，从而放弃了长达数月的反对这一有争议举措的斗争。【原文：South Korea’s main opposition party will support the government’s decision to scrap a plan to impose capital gains tax on financial investments of retail investors, dropping its months-long fight against the controversial move.】

item.title: 美元下跌，债券期货上涨，特朗普的部分交易受到关注
item.description: 由于周二美国大选前的民调数据促使一些投资者减少所谓的特朗普交易，美元指数创下 9 月下旬以来最大跌幅，国债期货上涨。【原文：A gauge of the dollar fell the most since late September and Treasury futures rose as polling data ahead of Tuesday’s US elections prompted some investors to pare the so-called Trump trades.】

item.title: 普洛斯取消债券销售表明对财务状况的担忧依然存在
item.description: 亚洲大型物流运营商普洛斯重新成为中国信贷市场的焦点，此前该公司放弃的美元债券销售重新引发了人们对其长期财务健康状况的担忧。【原文：Major Asian logistics operator GLP Pte has reemerged as a China credit focal point, after an abandoned dollar bond sale rekindled concerns about the firm’s long-term financial health.】

item.title: B.莱利支持的特许经营集团申请破产保护
item.description: Franchise Group Inc. 是 Vitamin Shoppe 和 Pet Supplies Plus 等品牌的所有者，在经历了数月的亏损和围绕其创始人及其支持者 B. Riley Financial Inc.【原文：Franchise Group Inc., the owner of brands including the Vitamin Shoppe and Pet Supplies Plus, filed for bankruptcy protection after months of losses and turmoil surrounding its founder and its backer B. Riley Financial Inc.】

item.title: 欧佩克+推迟提高产量，伊朗加强言论，石油价格上涨
item.description: 在欧佩克+同意将 12 月份的增产推迟一个月以及中东紧张局势再次升级之后，石油价格上涨。【原文：Oil advanced after OPEC+ agreed to push back its December production increase by one month and tensions again escalated in the Middle East.】

item.title: 美国民调显示领先者不明显，美元走软：市场综述
item.description: 最新的一系列美国总统大选民调数据显示，卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）和唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）之间没有明显的优势，美元因此走软。亚洲股市低开低走。【原文：The dollar weakened as the latest raft of US presidential election polling data showed no clear advantage between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump. Asian stocks were primed for a muted open.】

item.title: 矿产资源公司称埃里森将在调查后下台
item.description: 矿产资源有限公司（Mineral Resources Ltd.）表示，其富豪创始人克里斯-埃里森（Chris Ellison）将被处以 880 万澳元（580 万美元）的罚款，并将在 18 个月内下台，因为这家澳大利亚矿业公司对支付给他所拥有公司的未申报款项展开了调查。【原文：Mineral Resources Ltd. said its tycoon founder, Chris Ellison, will be penalized A$8.8 million ($5.8 million) and will step down within 18 months after the Australian miner launched an investigation into undeclared payments made to companies owned by him.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》称伊朗誓言对以色列发动 "强大而复杂 "的攻击
item.description: 华尔街日报》援引知情的伊朗和阿拉伯官员的话报道说，伊朗正在计划对以色列发动反击，其中包括威力更大的弹头和其他武器。【原文：Iran is planning a counterattack on Israel involving more powerful warheads and other weapons, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing Iranian and Arab officials briefed on the plans.】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 本周二，美国将举行总统选举，这可能会影响金价和美国可再生投资的未来走向。本周还将迎来美国农业报告，这些报告预示着全球小麦供应的状况。【原文：Americans go to the polls on Tuesday in a presidential election that could influence gold prices and the future path for US renewable investments. And this week gets bookended by US agricultural reports that signal how the world’s wheat supplies are faring.】

item.title: 摩尔多瓦亲欧盟总统即将在关键选举中获胜
item.description: 摩尔多瓦亲欧洲的总统有望在周日举行的一次关键选举中获胜，从而增强了她在本十年末带领这个前苏联加盟共和国加入欧盟的雄心。【原文：Moldova’s pro-European president was on course to win a crucial election on Sunday, bolstering her ambition to steer the former Soviet republic into the European Union by the end of the decade.】

item.title: 西太平洋银行利润超预期，增加股票回购
item.description: 西太平洋银行（Westpac Banking Corp.）的利润超过预期，原因是利率上调提高了该银行的利润率，并向投资者提供了价值 10 亿澳元（6.6 亿美元）的额外回购以及特别股息。【原文：Westpac Banking Corp.’s profit beat estimates as higher interest rates buoyed the bank’s margins and handed investors an additional buyback worth A$1 billion ($660 million) as well as a special dividend.】

item.title: 交易员准备迎接漫长而动荡的选举之夜
item.description:
随着结果逐步揭晓，一些咖啡因含量较高的投资者将密切关注利润率，并调整赌注，直至日出。【原文：

As the results trickle in, some highly caffeinated investors will be watching margins and tweaking their wagers until sunrise.

item.title: 从股票到加密货币，投资者为美国大选波动做好准备
item.description: 就在美国大选被认为是一场激烈的角逐之前，整个市场的期权交易商似乎都在降低风险，为更大的波动做准备。【原文：Just before a hotly contested US election considered a toss-up, options traders across markets appear to be reducing risk and bracing for more volatility.】

item.title: 检测显示，卢拉在十月头部受伤后健康状况稳定
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva）上个月在家中不慎摔倒，头部受伤，目前正在康复中，健康状况稳定。【原文：Brazil’s President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva’s health is stable as he recovers from a head injury suffered after a fall at his home last month.】

item.title: 巴菲特不断减持苹果股份，苹果价值今年下跌 60
item.description: 伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway Inc.【原文：Berkshire Hathaway Inc.’s continued sales of Apple Inc. shares in the third quarter left the conglomerate’s stake at a fraction of its size at the start of the year.】

item.title: 债券交易员迎接重要一周，赌注被收回
item.description: 在连续数周推动国债收益率走高后，交易员们在美国大选前纷纷撤出筹码，不愿在总统竞选悬而未决的情况下大胆押注债券。【原文：After driving Treasury yields higher for weeks, traders are taking chips off the table before the US election, reluctant to take bold bond bets with the presidential race too close to call.】

item.title: 欧佩克+再次推迟重启供应，原油价格陷入困境
item.description: 欧佩克+"同意将 12 月份的增产计划推迟一个月，这是欧佩克恢复供应计划的第二次推迟，因为在经济前景脆弱的情况下，价格仍在苦苦挣扎。【原文：OPEC+ agreed to push back its December production increase by one month, the second delay to its plans to revive supply as prices continue to struggle amid a fragile economic outlook.】

item.title: 桑坦德银行英国分行多年落后后面临新挑战
item.description: 桑坦德银行（Banco Santander SA）对其英国业务的不满情绪正在积聚，上周的裁员和昂贵的汽车金融审查只是让高管们头疼的最新事件，因为他们把其他国家放在了更优先的位置。【原文：Banco Santander SA’s frustrations with its British business are piling up, with job cuts and an expensive car finance review last week just the latest headaches for executives as they make other countries more of a priority.】

item.title: 巴菲特的 "蓝点 "奥马哈乐于成为总统的焦点
item.description: 奥马哈因其美味的牛排和亿万富翁投资者沃伦-巴菲特的故乡而闻名于世。但本周末，当地人正津津乐道于美国总统大选的焦点时刻。【原文：Omaha is best known for its good steaks and being billionaire investor Warren Buffett’s hometown. But this weekend, the locals are relishing their moment in the US presidential spotlight.】

item.title: 巴西财政部长应卢拉要求取消欧洲之行
item.description: 巴西财政部长费尔南多-哈达德（Fernando Haddad）取消了本周的欧洲之行，原因是雷亚尔汇率持续下跌，而且政府考虑削减的开支数额也存在不确定性。【原文：Brazil’s finance minister Fernando Haddad has canceled a trip to Europe this week amid extended losses of the real and uncertainty over the amount of spending cuts the government is considering.】

item.title: 大选焦虑笼罩新兴市场，投资者纷纷降低风险
item.description: 从墨西哥城到上海，经历了一年动荡的贸易商们正准备迎接新的政治冲击：美国总统大选有可能颠覆全球贸易，并有可能扰乱发展中国家的经济前景。【原文：From Mexico City to Shanghai, traders whipsawed by a volatile year are preparing for a fresh political jolt: A US presidential election that’s threatening to upend global trade and potentially roil the economic outlook across the developing world.】

item.title: 苹果终于通过新款 Mac Mini 找到了自己的游戏控制台
item.description: 新款 Mac mini 可能成为苹果对 PlayStation 和 Xbox 期待已久的回应。还有该公司计划于 12 月初推出下一个人工智能功能；发布令人失望的盈利指引并同意收购 Pixelmator；Peloton 的新首席执行官是苹果公司的前服务继承人。【原文：The new Mac mini could become Apple’s long-awaited answer to the PlayStation and Xbox. Also: The company’s next AI features are planned for early December; it delivers disappointing earnings guidance and agrees to acquire Pixelmator; and Peloton’s new CEO is Apple’s former services heir apparent.】

item.title: 华尔街的眼睛盯着大选，钱却不那么重要
item.description: 还剩一个交易日。周二，美国选民将开始挑选下一任总统，并有可能决定未来四年的经济走向。【原文：One trading session left. That’s all Wall Street has before Tuesday, when US voters begin the process of picking their next president and potentially determining the direction of the economy for the next four years.】

item.title: 中国敦促捷克政府帮助解决与欧盟的电动汽车争端
item.description: 中国商务部网站周日发布声明称，中国正敦促捷克政府发挥积极作用，帮助解决与欧盟之间有关电动汽车的贸易争端。【原文：China is urging the Czech government to play an active role in helping resolve the trade dispute with the European Union over electric vehicles, according to a statement posted on the Ministry of Commerce’s website on Sunday.】

item.title: 沙特 PIF 购入股份，中东顶级广播公司跃升 10
item.description: 在沙特阿拉伯王国主权财富基金同意以约 20 亿美元的价格从政府手中收购该公司的多数股权后，这家中东最大的广播公司在沙特阿拉伯的股价飙升了 10%。【原文：The Middle East’s biggest broadcaster surged as much as 10% in Saudi Arabia after the kingdom’s sovereign wealth fund agreed to buy a majority stake in the company from the government for about $2 billion.】

item.title: 媒体报道称香港被查封公寓以 1,400 万美元售出
item.description: 据多家当地媒体援引美联物业公司（Midland Realty）的报道称，被债权人查封的一套香港豪华公寓以 1.1 亿港元（约合 1410 万美元）的价格售出，比两年前的要价便宜了近 40%。【原文：A Hong Kong luxury apartment seized by creditors was sold for HK$110 million ($14.1 million), an almost 40% discount from its asking price two years ago, according to several local media reports, citing Midland Realty.】
